description.narrative: Resilience and Livelihoods/Durable Solutions for the Joint State Liaison Function (SLF-V) (Priority Area 1)

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1.1: Number of youth trained and equipped as peace ambassadors 1.1.2: Number of trust and confidence-building forums conducted 1.1.3: Number of water yard established 1.1.4: Number of CBRMs/ Farm Protection Committees established/strengthened
1.2.1: At least 100 entrepreneurs participated on the challenge competition 1.2.2: 500 business grants awarded to Youth and Women for productive and service sector enterprises 1.2.3: Income generation support to 8 associations is made 1.2.4: Darfur-wide value chain study conducted with at least 80 stakeholders interviewed 1.2.5: One entrepreneurship and Innovation Centre Constructed

comment.narrative:
1.1.1: 400 youth are deployed as ambassadors for peace and social cohesion. 1.1.2: 20 dialogue forums organized. 1.1.3: 1 water Yard established. 1.1.4: 40 CBRM and farm protection committees were established and are able to do mediate resolutions to inter-communal conflicts.
1.2.1: 400 youth entrepreneurs participate in the Business Innovation Challenge Competition 1.2.2: 200 business grants awarded to Youth and Women. 1.2.3: 8 Associations of vulnerable HHs Supported with Income Generation activities including. 1.2.4: Comprehensive Value Chain Study completed covering greater Darfur. 1.2.5: Construct entrepreneurship and innovation centre in El Fasher.

1.1.1 A total of 306 Youth Peace Ambassadors, including 37% women were selected and trained on peace promotion and social cohesion and deployed in 15 localities to promote peace and social cohesion. 1.1.2 Fourteen (14) Community Trust and Confidence-building dialogue forums were organized in North Darfur, South Darfur, East Darfur and West Darfur States. The forums were attended by 11,600 people (45% females). Beside the peace and social cohesion dialogue forums social events organized such as football matches, traditional dance and role play and drama were organized and attended by 9,500 people with 24% females. 1.1.3 This activity is linked to a similar activity under SLF4 due to budgetary constraints. Drilling and constructing Shag Hassan Water Yard, which will provide safe drinking water for humans and animals in Shag Hassan and Erate villages of Assalaya Locality in East Darfur state has reached advanced stages. This water yard will be completed and handed over in July 2021. 1.1.4 Twenty-nine (29) Community-Based Reconciliation Committees (CBRMs) with membership of 280 (with 20% females), were established and trained to mediate and resolve natural resource-based and inter-communal conflicts in North Darfur, South Darfur, East Darfur and West Darfur states.
1.2.1 The Darfur entrepreneurship and Business Innovation Challenge (Start Manage Your Own Business – SMYOB) was launched for youth and vulnerable women in four states (North Darfur, South Darfur, East Darfur and West Darfur). Over 2,400 applications were received, of which 147 applicants (77 males and 70 females) were selected and received entrepreneurial and business development and innovation training. 1.2.2 The project awarded 102 youth and vulnerable women grant prizes for their successful individual and group project proposals in the agriculture and service sectors, including interventions that respond to COVID-19 prevention projects. The Prizes ranges between SDG 100,000 to SDG 150,000 1.2.3 The project provided skill training and income generation support to 70 women and young girls in 4 associations through vocational and business development training utilizing the existing livelihood hubs/centres. As per the details below: • 17 Women received two-days of cheese making training. Training tools and materials were provided. • 18 Women received four-days of food processing training. Training tools and materials were provided. • 18 Women and youth received four-days of sewing and embroidery training. Training tools and materials were provided. • 17 Women received vocational training on Beauty and Hairdressing. Assorted Beauty and Hairdressing equipment, tools and material were donated to the MPLC. • All participants of the four vocational training received business development and small projects management sessions. • The beneficiaries include returnees and vulnerable households.
1.2.4 Due to shortage of funding, this activity has been integrated and completed within other UNDP Livelihoods activities funded directly by UNDP. 1.2.5 The construction of the entrepreneurship and innovation centre in El Fasher now is at advanced stages and is expected to be handed over by end of July 2021.

Output 1.2: Access to diversified livelihoods opportunities improved thus reducing conflict and competition over natural resources.
Targets: 1.2.1 Conduct comprehensive value chain study for opportunities in Agriculture sector in Darfur Region. 1.2.2 Construct youth entrepreneurship and innovation centre in El Fasher.

1.2.1 Due to shortage of funding, this activity has been integrated and completed within other UNDP Livelihoods activities funded directly by UNDP.
1.2.2 The construction of the entrepreneurship and innovation centre in El Fasher now is at advanced stages and is expected to be handed over by end of July 2021.
N/A. The project commenced activities in 2020.
N/A. The project commenced activities in 2020.
